name: Ken's Perfect Hard Boiled Egg (And I Mean Perfect)
author: Ken
summary: Couldn't sleep one night so I researched several ways to hard boil eggs and developed this process. While you do not taste the vinegar or salt, they both pull the skin from the eggshell so it peels easily without tearing or sticking. Family members call them 'Ken's Eggs'. Enjoy!
directions: Combine the salt, vinegar, and water in a large pot, and bring to a boil over high heat
Add the eggs one at a time, being careful not to crack them
Reduce the heat to a gentle boil, and cook for 14 minutes
Once the eggs have cooked, remove them from the hot water, and place into a container of ice water or cold, running water
Store in the refrigerator up to 1 week
